W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ ǀ ʐwæ˧zo˧-bv̩˧ ǀ ɣɯ˩ ɲi˥

NOTE.message: Input tones (separated by a space): #H LH

This item is said twice. The first time, the syllable /bv/ is realized on a high pitch in anticipation of the following Low tone. This process of phonetic dissimilation is extremely frequent in Yongning Na: a tone is realized higher in pitch when the following syllable has a phonologically lower tone (typically: M before L) and lower when the following syllable has a phonologically higher tone. So in the sequence ǀ MMML ǀ the third M tone is higher than the previous ones, and in ǀ MMMH ǀ the third M is lower than the previous ones.

W.FORM: ʈʂʰɯ˧ ǀ ʐwæ˧zo˧-bv̩˧ ǀ ɣɯ˩ ɲi˥
